item.title: A Brown University Instructor Hid From Gunfire With His Students
item.description: Joseph Oduro, 21, said he was leading an economics study session for about 60 students when a masked man entered the room and started shooting.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Rosman, Ashley Ahn and Jenna Russell

media:content.media:credit: Bing Guan/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: F.B.I. agents enter the Barus and Holley building, the site of a shooting at Brown University on Saturday.

item.title: 2 Students at Brown Witnessed School Shootings as Children
item.description: Both women said the shooting on Saturday had damaged a sense of security they had cultivated for years based on the notion that they were unlikely to witness two school shootings in one lifetime.
item.dc:creator: Camille Baker
item.category: Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School (Parkland, Fla)

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Law enforcement officers checking on residents at an apartment building on Waterman Street in Providence, R.I., on Saturday as people sheltered in place following a shooting near Brown University.

item.title: In Rome, the King of Paparazzi Is a Star in His Own Right
item.description: Rino Barillari has been snapping photos of, and sparring with, the famous for 65 years, from Princess Margaret to Lady Gaga, Peter O’Toole to Spike Lee. He is now a fixture himself in the celebrity firmament.
item.dc:creator: Elisabetta Povoledo

media:content.media:credit: Nadia Shira Cohen for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Rino Barillari, at Harry’s Bar, in Rome.

item.title: Quote of the Day: Biden Has Raised Little of What He Needs to Build a Typical Presidential Library
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, December 14, 2025.

item.title: AfD Pushes to Publish German Information That Officials Say May Help Russia
item.description: Opponents of AfD lawmakers say that their push to publish sensitive details about national security could benefit Russian military planning.
item.dc:creator: Christopher F. Schuetze

media:content.media:credit: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The leaders of the AfD, Tino Chrupalla, front left, and Alice Weidel, front center, have defended the party against accusations of compromising national security.

item.title: Gunshots, Sirens and a Manhunt Transform Brown’s Campus
item.description: A typical Saturday night on the Ivy League campus was shaken by the killing of two people and the wounding of 9 others.
item.dc:creator: Mark Arsenault and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: East Providence police officers in Providence, R.I., on Saturday.

item.title: What We Know About the Deadly Shooting at Brown University
item.description: Two people were killed and nine others injured during an attack on the Rhode Island campus. Officials were searching for a gunman late Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Yan Zhuang, By Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Mark Arsenault and Mitch Smith

media:content.media:credit: Mark Stockwell/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Police outside an entrance to Brown University in Providence, R.I., after a deadly shooting on Saturday.

item.title: What to Know About Brown University
item.description: Here’s what to know about the Rhode Island university, where a shooting on Saturday killed two people and injured eight others.
item.dc:creator: Dana Goldstein

media:content.media:credit: Tony Luong for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Brown University campus in Providence, R.I., in October.

item.title: At Least Two Killed in Shooting at Brown University
item.description: Students remained locked in their dorms and classrooms as the police searched for the shooter, who was described as a man wearing black. At least two people are dead, and eight are in critical condition.
item.dc:creator: McKinnon de Kuyper

media:content.media:credit: Mark Stockwell/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Emergency personnel on Waterman Street at Brown University in Providence, R.I., on Saturday.

item.title: Brown University Students Hide After Shooter Attacks Campus
item.description: On and around Brown’s campus in Providence, terrified students rushed to safety as word of a gunman on campus spread.
item.dc:creator: Rylee Kirk, Mitch Smith, Alan Blinder and Ashley Ahn

media:content.media:credit: Jen Mcdermott/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Police officers and emergency medical workers gathering in response to a shooting at Brown University in Providence, R.I., on Saturday.

item.title: Journalism, Interrupted: 7 Podcast Hosts on the State of the Media
item.description: A conversation with seven of the most influential hosts in podcasts and TV news.
item.dc:creator: Michael Barbaro, Rachelle Bonja, Lexie Diao, Dan Powell and Chris Wood

media:content.media:credit: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

item.title: Appeals Court Says Trump Must End Los Angeles Deployment by Monday
item.description: While the decision did not remove the National Guard troops from the president’s control, it blocked him from using them in the nation’s second-largest city.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Hubler
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Alex Welsh for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump deployed about 4,000 California National Guard troops to Los Angeles in June.

item.title: Change Locations
item.description: Zachary Edward-Brown and John Kugelman’s puzzle makes moving fun.
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Lovinger

media:content.media:credit: Sophie Park for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Two if by sea: Spectators this year at a 250th anniversary re-enactment of Paul Revere’s ride in Boston.

item.title: Live Updates: 2 Killed and 9 Injured in Brown University Shooting
item.description: Hundreds of police officers were searching for the gunman after he escaped into the streets of Rhode Island’s capital, officials said.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times

item.title: Six U.N. Peacekeepers Killed in Drone Strike in Sudanese Battle Zone
item.description: The strike on a United Nations base in the southern Kordofan region was the deadliest single episode for the body’s personnel in Sudan’s civil war.
item.dc:creator: Declan Walsh

media:content.media:credit: Ebrahim Hamid/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Sudanese rallied on Saturday in support of government forces in their battle against the rival Rapid Support Forces, in Omdurman, outside Khartoum, the capital.

item.title: Is Times New Roman Better Than Calibri for the State Department?
item.description: Type designers weigh in on the recent decision to replace Calibri with Times New Roman in official documents.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Corum

media:content.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: La ola delictiva que reconfigura la política de América Latina
item.description: La seguridad se ha convertido en una importante preocupación para los votantes de la región, que piden medidas de mano dura. Para Chile ha significado una inclinación hacia la derecha.
item.dc:creator: Emma Bubola and Sara Wayra

media:content.media:credit: Sara Wayra for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Chilean police raiding a house in Iquique during an anti-gang operation last month.

item.title: Abraham Quintanilla Jr., Music Producer and Father of Selena, Dies at 86
item.description: As a teenager, he hoped to make it big in the Tejano music world. He realized that dream through his daughter.
item.dc:creator: Jesus Jiménez

media:content.media:credit: Paul Iverson/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Abraham Quintanilla Jr. in 2017. With his daughter Selena doing vocals, he turned his small family band into a Grammy-winning act, and Selena became known as the queen of Tejano music.

item.title: Peter Greene, ‘Pulp Fiction’ and ‘The Mask’ Actor, Dies at 60
item.description: Mr. Greene, who built a four-decade career uncannily portraying villains, was found dead in his apartment in Manhattan on Friday, his manager said.
item.dc:creator: Derrick Bryson Taylor

media:content.media:credit: Desiree Navarro/Everett Collection, via Alamy Stock Photo
media:content.media:description: Peter Greene in New York in 2010. The New York Times once called his work “scarily authentic.”

item.title: La incautación del petrolero venezolano revela lo que Cuba hace con el crudo
item.description: En los últimos años solo una parte del petróleo venezolano destinado a Cuba ha llegado realmente a la isla, según los documentos de Pdvsa y los datos de seguimiento de los buques.
item.dc:creator: Anatoly Kurmanaev, Nicholas Nehamas and Farnaz Fassihi

media:content.media:credit: Vantor, vía Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Un petrolero llamado Skipper en el sur del mar Caribe. Fue incautado por Estados Unidos.

item.title: Flight Returns to Dulles After Engine Failure During Takeoff, F.A.A. Says
item.description: United Airlines Flight 803, which was headed to Tokyo, safely landed at Washington Dulles International Airport on Saturday, officials said.
item.dc:creator: Mark Walker and Aimee Ortiz

media:content.media:credit: Courtesy of Houman David Hemmati
media:content.media:description: Smoke from a fire near Washington Dulles International Airport on Saturday.

item.title: DoorDash Deliverer Faces Tampering Charges Tied to Food Order
item.description: The authorities said the woman, who was making a delivery for DoorDash, was captured on a doorbell camera spraying an unknown aerosol.
item.dc:creator: Aimee Ortiz

media:content.media:credit: Sean Sirota for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A woman who was making a DoorDash delivery was charged with battery and consumer product tampering after she was seen in doorbell footage aiming a spray from a can in the direction of the food order, officials said.

item.title: Roy Kramer, Transformational Executive in College Sports, Dies at 96
item.description: Leading the Southeastern Conference for 12 years, he masterminded its rise as a national power, lifted by a flood of money from TV rights, bowl games and other sources.
item.dc:creator: Richard Sandomir

item.title: Para Marco Rubio, la estrategia para Cuba pasa por Venezuela
item.description: El secretario de Estado y asesor de seguridad nacional del presidente Trump lleva mucho tiempo intentando socavar o derrocar al gobierno de Cuba, que mantiene estrechos vínculos económicos y de seguridad con Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Michael Crowley and Edward Wong

media:content.media:credit: Allison Robbert para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Los padres del secretario de Estado, Marco Rubio, emigraron a Florida desde La Habana tres años antes de que la revolución comunista cubana llegara al poder en 1959.

item.title: MAHA Moms Are Angry at the E.P.A. Lee Zeldin Is Trying to Win Them Back.
item.description: A split is emerging within Trump’s base as health activists accuse Mr. Zeldin of leading the agency to prioritize chemical industry interests over public health.
item.dc:creator: Hiroko Tabuchi

media:content.media:credit: Niki Chan Wylie for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Lee Zeldin, the E.P.A. administrator, appeared with Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. in Salt Lake City earlier this year. Recently, Mr. Zeldin has gone on a charm offensive.

item.title: The Young Conservatives Fixated on H-1B Visas
item.description: For some Gen Z conservatives, H-1B visas are a hot new topic.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Taylor Pemberton

media:content.media:credit: Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Young conservatives in the America First wing have fixated on the visa program as they grow disillusioned with the president’s promises on immigration and frustrated with the job market.

item.title: Israel Says It Killed Senior Hamas Commander, Despite Cease-Fire
item.description: Hamas said the attack on Saturday was a breach of the truce. The militant group did not comment on Israel’s claim to have killed one of its members.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Boxerman and Adam Rasgon

media:content.media:credit: Saher Alghorra for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A destroyed car following an Israeli strike in Gaza City on Saturday.

item.title: University of Maryland President Cleared of Plagiarism
item.description: The claims last year by a conservative publication against Darryll J. Pines prompted a yearlong investigation and an extensive review of his published works.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Saul

media:content.media:credit: Julio Cortez/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Darryll J. Pines, the University of Maryland’s president, has been cleared of plagiarism allegations.

item.title: Woody Allen Is Not Sorry About His Friendship With Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: The nonagenarian director is taking a slightly different tack than many of the other powerful people associated with the disgraced former financier.
item.dc:creator: Ginia Bellafante

media:content.media:credit: Agence France-Presse, via House Oversight Committee Democrats
media:content.media:description: An image released by the House Oversight Democrats showing Jeffrey Epstein with Woody Allen.

item.title: The Crime Wave Reshaping Latin American Politics
item.description: Security has become a top concern for voters across the region who are calling for iron-fisted measures. In Chile, the issue is pushing the country to the right.

media:content.media:credit: Sara Wayra for The New York Times

item.title: Roasted Orange Chicken Is Fancy and Festive
item.description: Genevieve Ko’s roasted orange chicken is so impressive and beautiful for how easy and simple it is.
item.dc:creator: Mia Leimkuhler

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Testani for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Simon Andrews. Prop Stylist: Caroline Dorn.
media:content.media:description: Genevieve Ko’s roasted orange chicken.

item.title: U.S.-U.K. Trade Deal Hits Stumbling Block
item.description: The U.S. government has paused a tech-focused trade pledge with Britain over broader disagreements about Britain’s digital regulations and food safety rules.
item.dc:creator: Eshe Nelson and Ana Swanson

media:content.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump and Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain in September, after signing an agreement that pledged to extend research collaborations and deepen partnerships in the tech industry.

item.title: Cómo mantener la paz con tu familia política
item.description: Los expertos comparten consejos para gestionar las dinámicas familiares complicadas en estas fiestas.
item.dc:creator: Jancee Dunn

item.title: Cherry Yum-Yum, One-Day Fruitcake and More Retro Desserts
item.description: This holiday, I’m leaning into retro charm with cherry yum-yum, one-day fruitcake and sock-it-to-me-cake.
item.dc:creator: Vaughn Vreeland

media:content.media:credit: Julia Gartland for The New York Times

item.title: Reader Mailbag: A Pause on Gerrymanders, and a Risk in Primaries
item.description: Indiana Republicans reject redrawn maps, and battle lines have been drawn among Democrats in Texas.
item.dc:creator: Nate Cohn

media:content.media:credit: Gabriela Bhaskar/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Jasmine Crockett entered the Texas Senate race.

item.title: Belarus Frees Prominent Political Prisoners as U.S. Lifts Some Trade Sanctions
item.description: The release of the prisoners, including a Nobel laureate and two opposition leaders, was part of a monthslong rapprochement between Washington and Minsk.
item.dc:creator: Valerie Hopkins and Tomas Dapkus

media:content.media:credit: Ints Kalnins/Reuters
media:content.media:description: Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya, a Belarusian opposition leader, welcoming Ales Bialiatski, a political activist released by Belarus, as he arrived Saturday at the U.S. Embassy in Vilnius, Lithuania.

item.title: 3 Americans Killed in ISIS Attack in Syria, Trump Says, Vowing to Retaliate
item.description: Two soldiers and a civilian interpreter were killed while supporting counterterror operations, the Pentagon said. They are the first U.S. casualties in Syria since the fall of the dictator Bashar al-Assad.
item.dc:creator: Abdi Latif Dahir, Christina Goldbaum, John Ismay and Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Baderkhan Ahmad/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: American Bradley fighting vehicles during a joint exercise in 2021 with Syrian Democratic Forces in northeastern Syria.

item.title: Jo Ann Allen Boyce Dies at 84; Braved Mobs in Integrating a School
item.description: She was one of the Clinton 12, Black students who broke a race barrier by entering a Tennessee high school in 1956 in the face of harassment by white segregationists.
item.dc:creator: Adam Nossiter
item.category: Brown v Board of Education (Supreme Court Decision)

media:content.media:credit: Don Cravens/Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Jo Ann Allen, left, and Minnie Ann Dickey at Clinton High School in Tennessee in September 1956, two years after the U.S. Supreme Court outlawed segregation in public schools.

item.title: Marina Yee, Elusive Avant-Garde Designer, Dies at 67
item.description: She was one of the Antwerp Six, young Belgians who upended the fashion industry with their innovative designs and turned their country into an unlikely style hub.
item.dc:creator: Penelope Green
item.category: Royal Academy of Fine Arts (Antwerp, Belgium)

item.title: Russia Bombs Ukraine Port of Odesa Amid Peace Talks
item.description: Much of Ukraine’s largest Black Sea port was without power, heat and water on Saturday after strikes from Russia, which has shown little appetite for a deal to end the war.
item.dc:creator: Kim Barker

media:content.media:credit: Nina Liashonok/Reuters
media:content.media:description: Firefighters on Saturday at the site of a Russian strike in Odesa, Ukraine.

item.title: Baby Steps
item.description: The antidote to our increasingly disembodied lives may lie in letting go of our inhibitions and dancing like kids do.
item.dc:creator: Melissa Kirsch

item.title: Can I Insist That My Dysfunctional Son Get a Vasectomy?
item.description: I’ve told him that I won’t continue supporting him unless he agrees.
item.dc:creator: Kwame Anthony Appiah

item.title: Trump’s Nvidia Deal Undermines National Security
item.description: This week, Donald Trump announced that he would allow Nvidia to sell its powerful H200 chips to China. The Times Opinion editor, Kathleen Kingsbury, argues that the move undermines national security.
